Detailed Description

Interface for interacting with Fragment Objects inside of a Page.

Definition at line 25 of file FragmentManager.h.

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum

Flag for popBackStack(const base::String&, int32_t) and popBackStack(int32_t, int32_t): If set, and the name or ID of a back stack entry has been supplied, then all matching entries will be consumed until one that doesn't match is found or the bottom of the stack is reached.

Otherwise, all entries up to but not including that entry will be removed.

Enumerator:
POP_BACK_STACK_INCLUSIVE 

Definition at line 67 of file FragmentManager.h.

Member Function Documentation

FragmentTransaction gaia::core::FragmentManager::beginTransaction ( )

Start a series of edit operations on the Fragments associated with this FragmentManager.

Note: A fragment transaction can only be created/committed prior to an activity saving its state. If you try to commit a transaction after Page::onSaveInstanceState() (and prior to a following Page::onStart or Page::onResume, you will get an error. This is because the framework takes care of saving your current fragments in the state, and if changes are made after the state is saved then they will be lost.

Fragment* gaia::core::FragmentManager::findFragmentById ( int32_t  id)

Finds a fragment that was identified by the given id as the container ID when added in a transaction.

This first searches through fragments that are currently added to the manager's page; if no such fragment is found, then all fragments currently on the back stack associated with this ID are searched.

Returns:
The fragment if found or null otherwise.
Fragment* gaia::core::FragmentManager::findFragmentByTag ( const base::String &  tag)

Finds a fragment that was identified by the given tag as supplied when added in a transaction.

This first searches through fragments that are currently added to the manager's activity; if no such fragment is found, then all fragments currently on the back stack are searched.

Returns:
The fragment if found or null otherwise.
int32_t gaia::core::FragmentManager::getBackStackEntryCount ( )

Return the BackStackEntry at index index in the back stack; entries start index 0 being the bottom of the stack.

Fragment* gaia::core::FragmentManager::getFragment ( Persistence *  persistence,
const base::String &  key 
)

Retrieve the current Fragment instance for a reference previously placed with putFragment(Persistence*, const base::String&, Fragment*).

Parameters:
persistenceThe bundle from which to retrieve the fragment reference.
keyThe name of the entry in the bundle.
Returns:
Returns the current Fragment instance that is associated with the given reference.
void gaia::core::FragmentManager::popBackStack ( )

Pop the top state off the back stack.

This function is asynchronous -- it enqueues the request to pop, but the action will not be performed until the application returns to its event loop.

void gaia::core::FragmentManager::popBackStack ( const base::String &  name,
int32_t  flags 
)

Pop the last fragment transition from the manager's fragment back stack.

If there is nothing to pop, false is returned. This function is asynchronous -- it enqueues the request to pop, but the action will not be performed until the application returns to its event loop.

Parameters:
nameIf non-null, this is the name of a previous back state to look for; if found, all states up to that state will be popped. The POP_BACK_STACK_INCLUSIVE flag can be used to control whether the named state itself is popped. If null, only the top state is popped.
flagsEither 0 or POP_BACK_STACK_INCLUSIVE.
void gaia::core::FragmentManager::popBackStack ( int32_t  id,
int32_t  flags 
)

Pop all back stack states up to the one with the given identifier.

This function is asynchronous -- it enqueues the request to pop, but the action will not be performed until the application returns to its event loop.

Parameters:
idIdentifier of the stated to be popped. If no identifier exists, false is returned. The identifier is the number returned by FragmentTransaction::commit(). The POP_BACK_STACK_INCLUSIVE flag can be used to control whether the named state itself is popped.
flagsEither 0 or POP_BACK_STACK_INCLUSIVE.
bool gaia::core::FragmentManager::popBackStackImmediate ( const base::String &  name,
int32_t  flags 
)

Like popBackStack(const base::String&, int32_t), but performs the operation immediately inside of the call.

Returns:
Returns true if there was something popped, else false.
bool gaia::core::FragmentManager::popBackStackImmediate ( int32_t  id,
int32_t  flags 
)

Like popBackStack(int32_t, int32_t), but performs the operation immediately inside of the call.

Returns:
Returns true if there was something popped, else false.
bool gaia::core::FragmentManager::popBackStackImmediate ( )

Like popBackStack(), but performs the operation immediately inside of the call.

Returns:
Returns true if there was something popped, else false.
void gaia::core::FragmentManager::putFragment ( Persistence *  persistence,
const base::String &  key,
Fragment *  fragment 
)

Put a reference to a fragment in a Bundle.

This Bundle can be persisted as saved state, and when later restoring getFragment(Persistence*, const base::String&) will return the current instance of the same fragment.

Parameters:
persistenceThe Persistence in which to put the fragment reference.
keyThe name of the entry in the bundle.
fragmentThe Fragment whose reference is to be stored.
